HHFM TRIP CALENDAR

Below is some basic information about the trips we offer.  If you or someone you know is interested in a trip, feel free to contact us for more information!!!  We look forward to hearing from you!



COST OF THE TRIP

The cost is $330 / person.  The price covers:

  • supplies for the worksite
  • lodging ($100 / person)
  • administrative costs   


The cost of Gas and food is up to the group.  However, if you would like help coming up with a budget, we would be happy to assist you!!!



LENGTH OF STAY

Because our focus is making homes safe and accessible, many of the jobs require more than 2-3 days of work.  Therefore, HHFM requires a MINIMUM of 4 full work days.  This does not include traveling.


ARRIVAL / DEPARTURE

Group leader(s) and HHFM will decide days, dates, times, etc.

Prior to departure, participants are expected to clean facilities.


ACCOMMODATIONS

Will be provided by HHFM

Sleeping arrangements will consist of bunk beds, cots, and / or air mattresses

Participants will need to provide bedding

There will be electricity and running water

Kitchens will also be available for use by the group


GROUP SIZES

Minimum of 8 - 10 participants

Maximum of 30 participants


AGES OF PARTICIPANTS

Minimum age of 14


RATIO OF YOUTH TO ADULTS

HHFM requires a ratio of 1 adult for every 5 youth


MEALS

groups / participants will be responsible for grocery shopping (directions to grocery stores will be provided) 

groups / participants will be responsible for providing meals

HHFM can / will assist with IDEAS about kitchen and food management if requested


TRANSPORTATION

Participating groups / participants will be in charge of providing transportation.

A MINIMUM of 1 truck is suggested to haul material.

Minivans / SUVs are suggested for the hauling of people, materials, and tools.


TYPICAL WORK PROJECTS

In order to make houses safe and accessible, groups will focus on the following projects (there can / will be guidance on-site if requested)

  • wheelchair ramps
  • flooring repairs
  • roofing
  • emergency exits
  • stairs
  • underpinning / skirting 


TYPICAL WORK DAY

8 am groups start working at chosen work sites

5-6pm  groups arrive back home (wherever group is staying)

Evening activities

  • dinner
  • free time
  • prayer / reflection time
  • cultural activities (can be arranged if requested)    
  • church services (can be arranged if requested)


SKILLS REQUIRED

NONE!!!  However, people with plumbing, electrical, and carpentry skills are ALWAYS welcome!

A willingness to learn


PAPERWORK / DOCUMENTS

Background checks

Safe and Sacred training (Catholic Groups)

Medical forms

HHFM liability waivers

Suggested Packing List









Our Goal:

Ensure people we work for have SAFE and ACCESSIBLE HOMES
